segments.text: This kitchen scene is kind of funny in a way.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The mom's so absorbed in her dish drying she misses the flood at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water's cascading over the sink like a waterfall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's got one foot in the puddle, totally unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then there's the boy on the stool, stretching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His little arm is deep in there, grabbing treats.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool's legs are all crooked; it's about to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's right there, hand out, ready for her share.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're like little thieves in the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside the window, the garden looks so calm and pretty.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe no one's noticing the dangers building up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But it's amusing how everyday life hides these mishaps.
segments.speaker: PAR
